updates.summary: Comprehensive lesson with step-by-step procedures, worked examples with detailed explanations, and 16 practice problems across 4 difficulty levels

features.title: Step-by-Step Procedures
features.description: Clear, numbered steps for both multiplication and division with decimals, breaking down complex operations into simple rules
examples: Multiplication: Ignore decimals → count total decimal places → place decimal in product
Division: Shift divisor to whole number → shift dividend same amount → divide normally

features.title: LaTeX-Rendered Examples
features.description: Professional mathematical notation for all formulas and examples using MathJax
examples: 2.3 × 1.4 = 3.22 (multiplication example)
4.2 ÷ 0.7 = 6 (division example with fraction notation)

features.title: Worked Examples with Detailed Solutions
features.description: Two complete examples showing step-by-step reasoning from start to finish
examples: Multiply 0.6 × 0.5: Shows ignoring decimals (6×5=30), counting decimal places (2 total), final answer (0.30)
Divide 12.6 ÷ 0.3: Shows decimal shifting (0.3→3, 12.6→126), division (126÷3=42)

features.title: 16 Practice Problems Across 4 Difficulty Levels
features.description: Progressive difficulty from basic single-decimal operations to extreme precision with many decimal places
examples: Challenge: 0.007 × 0.8, 0.063 ÷ 0.009 (4 problems)

features.title: Answer Explanations for Every Problem
features.description: Each practice problem includes both the answer and a step-by-step explanation showing the reasoning
examples: 0.4 × 0.2 = 0.08 | Explanation: 4 × 2 = 8, two decimal places → 0.08
4.5 ÷ 1.5 = 3 | Explanation: Shift both → 45 ÷ 15 = 3

features.title: Teaching Tips Section
features.description: Practical guidance for parents and tutors including real-world contexts and visual aids
examples: Always double-check decimal placement at the end
Practice with money (like $2.30 × 1.4)
Use grid or area models for younger kids to visualize multiplication

features.title: Interactive Show/Hide Answers
features.description: Toggle answers and explanations individually for self-paced learning and self-testing

learning_improvements: Step-by-step procedures demystify decimal operations
Explanations show the 'why' behind each step, not just mechanical rules
Progressive difficulty builds confidence from simple to complex problems
Real-world money context makes abstract decimals concrete
Answer explanations allow students to learn from mistakes independently
Extreme problems prepare advanced students for scientific notation and precision

features.description: Interactive animations showing how x^a ÷ x^b works by canceling matching 'buckets' of the base

examples: x² ÷ x⁵ → x⁻³ → 1/x³
